abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the National
            Community-Driven Development Project for Benin is to
            increase the utilization of the community-driven development
            approach and improve the access of the poorest communities
            to basic social and financial services. The closing date for
            the project will be extended from September 30, 2011 until
            April 30, 2012. The extension is required since
            implementation has been slowed by several factors: 1) new
            procedures applied late last year by the Caisse Autonome
            d'Amortissement have significantly lengthened the
            turn-around time for replenishing the special account, which
            in turn constrained financing of sub-projects; 2) several
            procurements for consultants (including the impact
            evaluation and technical audits) needed to be re-launched
            internationally because the processes did not yield
            applicants of sufficient capacity; and 3) the preparation of
            boites a outils in some ministries. The project has
            submitted a new work plan covering the period from June 2011
            to April 2012 that presents a credible program for finishing
            all activities by the revised closing date.  This will be
            the second extension of the project.
